sinaiticus.text: The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him, to show to his servants things that must shortly take place, and having sent by his angel he made it known to his servant John,

verses.text: The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him, to show to his servants things that must shortly take place, and having sent by his angel he made it known to his servant John,

sinaiticus.text: who became a witness to the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, whatever things he saw.

verses.text: who became a witness to the word of God and the testimony of Jesus Christ, whatever things he saw.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed is he that reads and they that hear the words of the prophecy, and that keep the things that are written in it; for the time is at hand.

verses.text: Blessed is he that reads and they that hear the words of the prophecy, and that keep the things that are written in it; for the time is at hand.

sinaiticus.text: John to the seven churches that are in Asia: grace to you and peace from him who is, and who was, and who comes, and from the seven spirits that are before his throne,

verses.text: John to the seven churches that are in Asia: grace to you and peace from him who is, and who was, and who comes, and from the seven spirits that are before his throne,

sinaiticus.text: and from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, the first-born of the dead and the prince of the kings of the earth. To him that loves us and that washed us from our sins in his blood,

verses.text: and from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, the first-born of the dead and the prince of the kings of the earth. To him that loves us and that washed us from our sins in his blood,

sinaiticus.text: and made us a kingdom, priests to his God and Father, to him be glory and strength through the ages: amen.

verses.text: and made us a kingdom, priests to his God and Father, to him be glory and strength through the ages: amen.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, he comes with clouds, and every eye shall see him, and they also that pierced him, and all the tribes of the land shall wail because of him. Yes, amen.

verses.text: Behold, he comes with clouds, and every eye shall see him, and they also that pierced him, and all the tribes of the land shall wail because of him. Yes, amen.

sinaiticus.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, says the Lord God, who is, and who was, and who comes, the Almighty.

verses.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, says the Lord God, who is, and who was, and who comes, the Almighty.

sinaiticus.text: I John, your brother and companion in the affliction and kingdom and patience in Jesus, was in the island that is called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.

verses.text: I John, your brother and companion in the affliction and kingdom and patience in Jesus, was in the island that is called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony of Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: I was in-spirit on the Lord’s day and heard behind me a voice great as that of a trumpet,

verses.text: I was in-spirit on the Lord’s day and heard behind me a voice great as that of a trumpet,

sinaiticus.text: saying: What thou seest write in a book, and send to the seven churches, to Ephesus, and to Smyrna, and to Pergamus, and to Thyatira, and to Sardis, and to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea.

verses.text: saying: What thou seest write in a book, and send to the seven churches, to Ephesus, and to Smyrna, and to Pergamus, and to Thyatira, and to Sardis, and to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea.

sinaiticus.text: And I turned to see the voice that talked with me; and having turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks,

verses.text: And I turned to see the voice that talked with me; and having turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks,

sinaiticus.text: and in the midst of the candlesticks one like the Son of man, clothed in a robe reaching to the feet, and girded about the breasts with a golden girdle;

verses.text: and in the midst of the candlesticks one like the Son of man, clothed in a robe reaching to the feet, and girded about the breasts with a golden girdle;

sinaiticus.text: but his head and his hair were white as white wool, like snow, and his eyes were as a flame of fire,

verses.text: but his head and his hair were white as white wool, like snow, and his eyes were as a flame of fire,

sinaiticus.text: and his feet were like burnished brass, as if they burned in a furnace, and his voice as the sound of many waters;

verses.text: and his feet were like burnished brass, as if they burned in a furnace, and his voice as the sound of many waters;

sinaiticus.text: and he had in his right hand seven stars, and out of his mouth went forth a sword two-edged, sharp, and his face as the sun when it

verses.text: and he had in his right hand seven stars, and out of his mouth went forth a sword two-edged, sharp, and his face as the sun when it

sinaiticus.text: And when I had seen him, I fell at his feet as dead; and he laid his right hand upon me, saying: Fear not: I am the First and the Last,

verses.text: And when I had seen him, I fell at his feet as dead; and he laid his right hand upon me, saying: Fear not: I am the First and the Last,

sinaiticus.text: and that lives, and I was dead, and behold, I am living from age to age, and have the keys of death and of hades.

verses.text: and that lives, and I was dead, and behold, I am living from age to age, and have the keys of death and of hades.

sinaiticus.text: Write therefore the things that thou sawest, and the things that are, and those that shall be after these,

verses.text: Write therefore the things that thou sawest, and the things that are, and those that shall be after these,

sinaiticus.text: the mystery of the seven stars that thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks. The seven stars and angels of the seven churches, and the seven candlesticks are seven churches.

verses.text: the mystery of the seven stars that thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks. The seven stars and angels of the seven churches, and the seven candlesticks are seven churches.

sinaiticus.text: To the angel of the church in Ephesus write: These things says he that holds the seven stars in his right hand, that walks in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;

verses.text: To the angel of the church in Ephesus write: These things says he that holds the seven stars in his right hand, that walks in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;

sinaiticus.text: I know thy works, and thy labor, and thy patience, and that thou canst not endure evil men, and hast tried those that say that they are apostles and are not, and hast found them liars;

verses.text: I know thy works, and thy labor, and thy patience, and that thou canst not endure evil men, and hast tried those that say that they are apostles and are not, and hast found them liars;

sinaiticus.text: and thou hast patience, and hast endured because of my name, and hast not fainted.

verses.text: and thou hast patience, and hast endured because of my name, and hast not fainted.

sinaiticus.text: But I have against thee that thou hast left thy first love.

verses.text: But I have against thee that thou hast left thy first love.

sinaiticus.text: Remember therefore whence thou hast fallen, and repent and do the first works: else, I am coming to thee, and will move thy candlestick out of its place, unless thou repent.

verses.text: Remember therefore whence thou hast fallen, and repent and do the first works: else, I am coming to thee, and will move thy candlestick out of its place, unless thou repent.

sinaiticus.text: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

verses.text: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the works of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches: To him that overcomes will I give to eat of the tree of life, which is in the paradise of my God.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches: To him that overcomes will I give to eat of the tree of life, which is in the paradise of my God.

sinaiticus.text: And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write: These things says the First and the Last, who was dead and revived;

verses.text: And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write: These things says the First and the Last, who was dead and revived;

sinaiticus.text: I know thy affliction and thy poverty,  and the blasphemy of those that say that they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan.

verses.text: I know thy affliction and thy poverty,  and the blasphemy of those that say that they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan.

sinaiticus.text: Fear in no way the things that thou art about to suffer. Behold now, the devil is about to cast some of you into prison that you may be tried, and you shall have affliction ten days. Be thou faithful to death, and I will give thee the crown of life.

verses.text: Fear in no way the things that thou art about to suffer. Behold now, the devil is about to cast some of you into prison that you may be tried, and you shall have affliction ten days. Be thou faithful to death, and I will give thee the crown of life.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches: He that overcomes shall not be hurt by the second death.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches: He that overcomes shall not be hurt by the second death.

sinaiticus.text: And to the angel of the church in Pergamus write: These things says he that has the sword two-edged, sharp;

verses.text: And to the angel of the church in Pergamus write: These things says he that has the sword two-edged, sharp;

sinaiticus.text: I know where thou dwellest, where the throne of Satan is; and yet thou boldest fast my name, and didst not deny my faith, even in the438 days in which Antipas was my faithful witness, who was slain among you, where Satan dwells.

verses.text: I know where thou dwellest, where the throne of Satan is; and yet thou boldest fast my name, and didst not deny my faith, even in the438 days in which Antipas was my faithful witness, who was slain among you, where Satan dwells.

sinaiticus.text: But I have against thee a few things: thou hast there those that hold the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling- block before the sons of Israel and to cause them to eat idol-sacrifices and to commit lewdness.

verses.text: But I have against thee a few things: thou hast there those that hold the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling- block before the sons of Israel and to cause them to eat idol-sacrifices and to commit lewdness.

sinaiticus.text: So hast thou also in like manner those that hold the teaching of the Nicolaitans.

verses.text: So hast thou also in like manner those that hold the teaching of the Nicolaitans.

sinaiticus.text: Repent therefore; otherwise I am coming to thee quickly, and I will war against them with the sword of my mouth.

verses.text: Repent therefore; otherwise I am coming to thee quickly, and I will war against them with the sword of my mouth.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches: To him that overcomes I will give of the hidden manna; and I will give him a white stone, and on the stone a new name written, which no one knows but he that receives it.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches: To him that overcomes I will give of the hidden manna; and I will give him a white stone, and on the stone a new name written, which no one knows but he that receives it.

sinaiticus.text: And to the angel of the church in Thyatira write: These things says the Son of God, who has his eyes as a flame of fire, and his feet like burnished brass:

verses.text: And to the angel of the church in Thyatira write: These things says the Son of God, who has his eyes as a flame of fire, and his feet like burnished brass:

sinaiticus.text: I know thy works and thy love and thy faith and thy service and thy patience, and thy works the last more than the first.

verses.text: I know thy works and thy love and thy faith and thy service and thy patience, and thy works the last more than the first.

sinaiticus.text: But I have against thee that thou sufferest thy wife Jezebel, who says that she is a prophetess, and teaches and leads my servants astray to commit lewdness and to eat idol-sacrifices.

verses.text: But I have against thee that thou sufferest thy wife Jezebel, who says that she is a prophetess, and teaches and leads my servants astray to commit lewdness and to eat idol-sacrifices.

sinaiticus.text: And I gave her time to repent, and she will not repent of her lewdness.

verses.text: And I gave her time to repent, and she will not repent of her lewdness.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, I cast her into a bed, and those that commit adultery with her into great affliction, unless they repent of her works.

verses.text: Behold, I cast her into a bed, and those that commit adultery with her into great affliction, unless they repent of her works.

sinaiticus.text: And her children will I kill with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he that searches the reins and the hearts; and I will give to you, to each one, according to your works.

verses.text: And her children will I kill with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he that searches the reins and the hearts; and I will give to you, to each one, according to your works.

sinaiticus.text: But to you I say, to the rest that are in Thyatira, as many as have not this teaching, such as have not known the depths of Satan, as they say, I lay upon you no other burden;

verses.text: But to you I say, to the rest that are in Thyatira, as many as have not this teaching, such as have not known the depths of Satan, as they say, I lay upon you no other burden;

sinaiticus.text: but what you have hold fast till I come.

verses.text: but what you have hold fast till I come.

sinaiticus.text: And he that overcomes and that keeps my works to the end, to him will I give authority over the nations,

verses.text: And he that overcomes and that keeps my works to the end, to him will I give authority over the nations,

sinaiticus.text: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron, as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to pieces, as I have received from my Father,

verses.text: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron, as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to pieces, as I have received from my Father,

sinaiticus.text: and I will give him the morning star.

verses.text: and I will give him the morning star.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

sinaiticus.text: And to the angel of the church in Sardis write: These things says he that has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

verses.text: And to the angel of the church in Sardis write: These things says he that has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

sinaiticus.text: Become wakeful, and strengthen the things that remain that are about to die. For I have not found thy works fulfilled before my God.

verses.text: Become wakeful, and strengthen the things that remain that are about to die. For I have not found thy works fulfilled before my God.

sinaiticus.text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and watch and repent. If therefore thou wilt not be wakeful, I will come as a thief, and thou shalt not know at what hour I will come upon thee.

verses.text: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and watch and repent. If therefore thou wilt not be wakeful, I will come as a thief, and thou shalt not know at what hour I will come upon thee.

sinaiticus.text: But thou hast a few names in Sardis who have not defiled their garments, and they shall walk with me in white, for they are worthy.

verses.text: But thou hast a few names in Sardis who have not defiled their garments, and they shall walk with me in white, for they are worthy.

sinaiticus.text: He that overcomes, he shall be clothed in white raiment, and I will not blot his name out of the book of life, and I will confess his name before my Father and before his angels.

verses.text: He that overcomes, he shall be clothed in white raiment, and I will not blot his name out of the book of life, and I will confess his name before my Father and before his angels.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

sinaiticus.text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write: These things says he that is holy, he that is true, he that has the key of David, he that opens and no one shall shut, and shuts and no one shall open;

verses.text: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write: These things says he that is holy, he that is true, he that has the key of David, he that opens and no one shall shut, and shuts and no one shall open;

sinaiticus.text: I know thy works; behold, I have placed before thee an open door, that no one can shut; because thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word and hast not denied my name.

verses.text: I know thy works; behold, I have placed before thee an open door, that no one can shut; because thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word and hast not denied my name.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, I will give to them of the synagogue of Satan, that say that they are Jews, and are not, but do lie: behold, I will make them come and worship before thy feet, and they shall know that I have loved thee.

verses.text: Behold, I will give to them of the synagogue of Satan, that say that they are Jews, and are not, but do lie: behold, I will make them come and worship before thy feet, and they shall know that I have loved thee.

sinaiticus.text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation that shall come on all the world, to try them that dwell on the earth.

verses.text: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation that shall come on all the world, to try them that dwell on the earth.

sinaiticus.text: I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no one take thy crown.

verses.text: I come quickly: hold fast that which thou hast, that no one take thy crown.

sinaiticus.text: He that overcomes, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go out no more, and I will write upon him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem that comes down out of heaven from my God, and my new name.

verses.text: He that overcomes, I will make him a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go out no more, and I will write upon him the name of my God and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem that comes down out of heaven from my God, and my new name.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

sinaiticus.text: And to the angel of the church in Laodicea write: These things says the Amen, the witness that is faithful and true, the beginning of the creation of God;

verses.text: And to the angel of the church in Laodicea write: These things says the Amen, the witness that is faithful and true, the beginning of the creation of God;

sinaiticus.text: 1 know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot. I would that thou wert either cold or hot.

verses.text: 1 know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot. I would that thou wert either cold or hot.

sinaiticus.text: So because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will vomit thee out of my mouth.440

verses.text: So because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will vomit thee out of my mouth.440

sinaiticus.text: Because thou sayest: I am rich and have abundance and have need of nothing, and knowest not that thou art wretched and pitiable and poor and blind and naked,

verses.text: Because thou sayest: I am rich and have abundance and have need of nothing, and knowest not that thou art wretched and pitiable and poor and blind and naked,

sinaiticus.text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold purified in fire, that thou mayest be rich, and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and the shame of thy nakedness may not be made manifest, and to anoint thy eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

verses.text: I counsel thee to buy of me gold purified in fire, that thou mayest be rich, and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and the shame of thy nakedness may not be made manifest, and to anoint thy eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

sinaiticus.text: As many as I love I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

verses.text: As many as I love I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, I stand at the door and knock: if any one hear my voice and open the door, I will come in to him and will sup with him and he with me.

verses.text: Behold, I stand at the door and knock: if any one hear my voice and open the door, I will come in to him and will sup with him and he with me.

sinaiticus.text: He that overcomes, I will give to him to sit with me in my throne, as I also overcame and sat down with my Father in his throne.

verses.text: He that overcomes, I will give to him to sit with me in my throne, as I also overcame and sat down with my Father in his throne.

sinaiticus.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

verses.text: He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.

sinaiticus.text: After these things I saw, and behold, a door opened in heaven, and the voice, the first that I heard, was as that of a trumpet talking with me, saying: Come up hither, and I will show thee things that must take place after these.

verses.text: After these things I saw, and behold, a door opened in heaven, and the voice, the first that I heard, was as that of a trumpet talking with me, saying: Come up hither, and I will show thee things that must take place after these.

sinaiticus.text: Immediately I was in spirit; and behold, a throne was set in heaven and upon the throne was one sitting,

verses.text: Immediately I was in spirit; and behold, a throne was set in heaven and upon the throne was one sitting,

sinaiticus.text: and he that sat was like in appearance to a jasper and a sardine stone, and a rainbow round about the throne, like in appearance to an emerald.

verses.text: and he that sat was like in appearance to a jasper and a sardine stone, and a rainbow round about the throne, like in appearance to an emerald.

sinaiticus.text: And round about the throne were twenty-four thrones; and upon the twenty-four thrones I saw elders sitting, clothed in white raiment, and on their head golden crowns.

verses.text: And round about the throne were twenty-four thrones; and upon the twenty-four thrones I saw elders sitting, clothed in white raiment, and on their head golden crowns.

sinaiticus.text: And out of the throne go forth lightnings and voices and thunders; and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven spirits of God;

verses.text: And out of the throne go forth lightnings and voices and thunders; and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven spirits of God;

sinaiticus.text: and before the throne was as a sea of glass like crystal; and in the midst of the throne and round about the throne four living creatures full of eyes before and behind.

verses.text: and before the throne was as a sea of glass like crystal; and in the midst of the throne and round about the throne four living creatures full of eyes before and behind.

sinaiticus.text: And the first living creature was like a lion, and the second living creature was like a calf, and the third living creature had the face as of a man, and the fourth living creature was like a flying eagle.

verses.text: And the first living creature was like a lion, and the second living creature was like a calf, and the third living creature had the face as of a man, and the fourth living creature was like a flying eagle.

sinaiticus.text: And the four living creatures, each of them having six wings, are full of eyes round about and within, and have no rest day and night, saying: Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God, the Almighty, who was, and

verses.text: And the four living creatures, each of them having six wings, are full of eyes round about and within, and have no rest day and night, saying: Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God, the Almighty, who was, and

sinaiticus.text: And whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to him that sits upon the throne, who lives from age to age,

verses.text: And whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to him that sits upon the throne, who lives from age to age,

sinaiticus.text: the twenty-four elders fall before him that sits upon the throne, and worship him that live, from age to age, and throw their crowns before the throne, saying:

verses.text: the twenty-four elders fall before him that sits upon the throne, and worship him that live, from age to age, and throw their crowns before the throne, saying:

sinaiticus.text: Worthy art thou, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for thou didst create all things, and because of thy will they existed and were created.

verses.text: Worthy art thou, our Lord and God, to receive glory and honor and power, for thou didst create all things, and because of thy will they existed and were created.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the back, sealed with seven seals.

verses.text: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the back, sealed with seven seals.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice: Who is worthy to open the book and break its seals?

verses.text: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice: Who is worthy to open the book and break its seals?

sinaiticus.text: And no one in heaven, neither on the earth nor under the earth, was able to open the book nor to look upon it.

verses.text: And no one in heaven, neither on the earth nor under the earth, was able to open the book nor to look upon it.

sinaiticus.text: And I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open the book nor to look upon it.

verses.text: And I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open the book nor to look upon it.

sinaiticus.text: And one of the elders said to me: Weep not; behold, he has prevailed who is the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, that opens the book and its seven seals.

verses.text: And one of the elders said to me: Weep not; behold, he has prevailed who is the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the root of David, that opens the book and its seven seals.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a Lamb standing as if it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the. seven spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

verses.text: And I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a Lamb standing as if it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the. seven spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And he came and took it out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

verses.text: And he came and took it out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had taken the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the lamb, having each one a harp and golden vials full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.

verses.text: And when he had taken the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the lamb, having each one a harp and golden vials full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.

sinaiticus.text: And they sing a new song, saying: Worthy art thou to take the book, and to open its seals, because thou wast slain and didst redeem to God in thy blood out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation,

verses.text: And they sing a new song, saying: Worthy art thou to take the book, and to open its seals, because thou wast slain and didst redeem to God in thy blood out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation,

sinaiticus.text: and didst make them a kingdom and priests, and they shall reign on the earth.

verses.text: and didst make them a kingdom and priests, and they shall reign on the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the living creatures and the elders, and the number of them was myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands.

verses.text: And I saw, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the living creatures and the elders, and the number of them was myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands.

sinaiticus.text: saying with a loud voice: Worthy is the Lamb that was slam to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honor, and glory, and blessing.

verses.text: saying with a loud voice: Worthy is the Lamb that was slam to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honor, and glory, and blessing.

sinaiticus.text: And every created thing that is in heaven, and those that are on the earth, and under the earth, and in the sea, even those in them, all442 did I hear saying: To him that sits on the throne and to the Lamb be blessing, and honor, and glory, and might, from age to age.

verses.text: And every created thing that is in heaven, and those that are on the earth, and under the earth, and in the sea, even those in them, all442 did I hear saying: To him that sits on the throne and to the Lamb be blessing, and honor, and glory, and might, from age to age.

sinaiticus.text: And the four living creatures heard I saying: Amen; and the elders fell down and worshipped.

verses.text: And the four living creatures heard I saying: Amen; and the elders fell down and worshipped.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw when the Lamb had opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures saying as with a voice of thunder: Come.

verses.text: And I saw when the Lamb had opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures saying as with a voice of thunder: Come.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw, and behold, a white horse, and he that sat upon him had a bow, and to him was given a crown, and he went forth conquering and to conquer.

verses.text: And I saw, and behold, a white horse, and he that sat upon him had a bow, and to him was given a crown, and he went forth conquering and to conquer.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had opened the second seal. I heard the second living creature saying: Come.

verses.text: And when he had opened the second seal. I heard the second living creature saying: Come.

sinaiticus.text: And there went forth another horse that was red; and to him that sat on him was given to take peace from the earth, and that they should slay one another: and there was given to him a great sword.

verses.text: And there went forth another horse that was red; and to him that sat on him was given to take peace from the earth, and that they should slay one another: and there was given to him a great sword.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying: Come. And I saw, and behold, a black horse, and he that sat on him had a balance in his hand.

verses.text: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying: Come. And I saw, and behold, a black horse, and he that sat on him had a balance in his hand.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying: A choenix of wheat for a denarius, and three choenices of barley for a denarius: and see that thou hurt not the oil and the wine.

verses.text: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying: A choenix of wheat for a denarius, and three choenices of barley for a denarius: and see that thou hurt not the oil and the wine.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living creature saying: Come.

verses.text: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the fourth living creature saying: Come.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw, and behold, a pale horse, and he that sat on him, his name was death, and hades followed with him; and there was given to them authority over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with the sword and with famine and with death and by the wild beasts of the earth.

verses.text: And I saw, and behold, a pale horse, and he that sat on him, his name was death, and hades followed with him; and there was given to them authority over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with the sword and with famine and with death and by the wild beasts of the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those that had been slain because of the word of God and because of the testimony that they held.

verses.text: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those that had been slain because of the word of God and because of the testimony that they held.

sinaiticus.text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying: How long, O Sovereign holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?

verses.text: And they cried with a loud voice, saying: How long, O Sovereign holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?

sinaiticus.text: And there was given to them a white robe, and it was said to them that they should rest yet a while, till the number of their fellow servants and their brethren that should be killed as they had been should be fulfilled.

verses.text: And there was given to them a white robe, and it was said to them that they should rest yet a while, till the number of their fellow servants and their brethren that should be killed as they had been should be fulfilled.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw when he had opened the sixth seal, and there was a great earthquake, and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and

verses.text: And I saw when he had opened the sixth seal, and there was a great earthquake, and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and

sinaiticus.text: and the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig tree casting her untimely figs when shaken by a mighty wind,

verses.text: and the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig tree casting her untimely figs when shaken by a mighty wind,

sinaiticus.text: and the heaven departed as a scroll rolled together, and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

verses.text: and the heaven departed as a scroll rolled together, and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

sinaiticus.text: And the kings of the earth and the great men and the officers and the rich and the mighty and every servant and free man hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains,

verses.text: And the kings of the earth and the great men and the officers and the rich and the mighty and every servant and free man hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains,

sinaiticus.text: and said to the mountains and rocks: Fall upon us and conceal us from the face of him that sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb.

verses.text: and said to the mountains and rocks: Fall upon us and conceal us from the face of him that sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: for the great day of his wrath has come, and who is able to stand?

verses.text: for the great day of his wrath has come, and who is able to stand?

sinaiticus.text: And after this I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth nor on the sea nor on any tree.

verses.text: And after this I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth nor on the sea nor on any tree.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw another angel ascending from the rising of the sun, having the seal of the living God; and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

verses.text: And I saw another angel ascending from the rising of the sun, having the seal of the living God; and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Hurt not the earth nor the sea nor the trees, till we shall have sealed the servants of our God on their foreheads.

verses.text: saying: Hurt not the earth nor the sea nor the trees, till we shall have sealed the servants of our God on their foreheads.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard the number of those that were sealed; a hundred and forty-four thousand were sealed of every tribe of the sons of Israel:

verses.text: And I heard the number of those that were sealed; a hundred and forty-four thousand were sealed of every tribe of the sons of Israel:

sinaiticus.text: of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand: of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand:

verses.text: of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand: of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand:

sinaiticus.text: of the tribe of Asher twelve thousand; of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand; of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand;

verses.text: of the tribe of Asher twelve thousand; of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand; of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand;

sinaiticus.text: of the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand; of the tribe of Levi twelve thousand; of the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand;

verses.text: of the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand; of the tribe of Levi twelve thousand; of the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand;

sinaiticus.text: of the tribe of Zebulon twelve thousand; of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand; of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand were sealed.

verses.text: of the tribe of Zebulon twelve thousand; of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand; of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand were sealed.

sinaiticus.text: After these things I saw, and behold, a great multitude, which no one could number, out of every nation and the tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;

verses.text: After these things I saw, and behold, a great multitude, which no one could number, out of every nation and the tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;

sinaiticus.text: and they cry with a loud voice, saying: Salvation to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb.

verses.text: and they cry with a loud voice, saying: Salvation to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: And all the angels stood round about the throne and the elders and the living creatures, and fell before the throne on their faces and worshipped God,

verses.text: And all the angels stood round about the throne and the elders and the living creatures, and fell before the throne on their faces and worshipped God,

sinaiticus.text: saying: Amen, blessing and glory and wisdom and thanks and honor and power and strength to our God from age to age.444

verses.text: saying: Amen, blessing and glory and wisdom and thanks and honor and power and strength to our God from age to age.444

sinaiticus.text: And one of the elders answered, saying to me: These “that are clothed in white robes, who are they and whence came they?

verses.text: And one of the elders answered, saying to me: These “that are clothed in white robes, who are they and whence came they?

sinaiticus.text: And I said to him: My lord, thou knowest. And he said to me: These are they that come out of great affliction, and they washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

verses.text: And I said to him: My lord, thou knowest. And he said to me: These are they that come out of great affliction, and they washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore are they before the throne of God, and they serve him day and night in his temple, and he that sits on the throne shall dwell among them.

verses.text: Therefore are they before the throne of God, and they serve him day and night in his temple, and he that sits on the throne shall dwell among them.

sinaiticus.text: They shall hunger no more, neither shall they thirst any more, neither shall the sun fall upon them, nor any heat,

verses.text: They shall hunger no more, neither shall they thirst any more, neither shall the sun fall upon them, nor any heat,

sinaiticus.text: for the Lamb that is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and lead them to living fountains of waters, and God shall wipe away every tear from their eyes.

verses.text: for the Lamb that is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and lead them to living fountains of waters, and God shall wipe away every tear from their eyes.

sinaiticus.text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

verses.text: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw the seven angels that stand before God, and to them were given seven trumpets.

verses.text: And I saw the seven angels that stand before God, and to them were given seven trumpets.

sinaiticus.text: And another angel came and stood by the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given to him much incense, that he should offer it with the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar that is before the throne.

verses.text: And another angel came and stood by the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given to him much incense, that he should offer it with the prayers of all the saints on the golden altar that is before the throne.

sinaiticus.text: And the smoke of the incense ascended with the prayers of the saints out of the hand of the angel before God.

verses.text: And the smoke of the incense ascended with the prayers of the saints out of the hand of the angel before God.

sinaiticus.text: And the angel took the censer, and filled it from the fire of the altar and threw it into the earth; and there were thunders, and lightnings, and voices, and an earthquake.

verses.text: And the angel took the censer, and filled it from the fire of the altar and threw it into the earth; and there were thunders, and lightnings, and voices, and an earthquake.

sinaiticus.text: And the seven angels that had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

verses.text: And the seven angels that had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

sinaiticus.text: And the first sounded; and there was hail and fire mingled with blood, and it was thrown into the earth; and the third part of the earth was burned up, and the third part of the trees was burned up, and all green grass was burned up.

verses.text: And the first sounded; and there was hail and fire mingled with blood, and it was thrown into the earth; and the third part of the earth was burned up, and the third part of the trees was burned up, and all green grass was burned up.

sinaiticus.text: And the second angel sounded; and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea; and the third part of the sea became blood,

verses.text: And the second angel sounded; and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea; and the third part of the sea became blood,

sinaiticus.text: and the third part of the creatures that were in the sea, that had life, died, and the third part of the ships were destroyed.

verses.text: and the third part of the creatures that were in the sea, that had life, died, and the third part of the ships were destroyed.

sinaiticus.text: And the third angel sounded; and there fell from heaven a great star burning as a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers

verses.text: And the third angel sounded; and there fell from heaven a great star burning as a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers

sinaiticus.text: And the name of the star is called Wormwood. And the third part of the waters became wormwood, and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

verses.text: And the name of the star is called Wormwood. And the third part of the waters became wormwood, and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

sinaiticus.text: And the fourth angel sounded; and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars, that the third part of them might be darkened, and the day might not shine for the third part of it, and the night likewise.

verses.text: And the fourth angel sounded; and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars, that the third part of them might be darkened, and the day might not shine for the third part of it, and the night likewise.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw, and heard an eagle flying in the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice: Woe, woe, woe to them that dwell on the earth because of the rest of the voices of the trumpet of the three angels that are about to sound.

verses.text: And I saw, and heard an eagle flying in the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice: Woe, woe, woe to them that dwell on the earth because of the rest of the voices of the trumpet of the three angels that are about to sound.

sinaiticus.text: And the fifth angel sounded: and I saw a star that had fallen from heaven to the earth, and to him was given the key of the pit of the abyss.

verses.text: And the fifth angel sounded: and I saw a star that had fallen from heaven to the earth, and to him was given the key of the pit of the abyss.

sinaiticus.text: And he opened the pit of the abyss; and there arose out of the pit a smoke as the smoke of a great furnace, and the sun and the air were darkened by means of the smoke of the pit.

verses.text: And he opened the pit of the abyss; and there arose out of the pit a smoke as the smoke of a great furnace, and the sun and the air were darkened by means of the smoke of the pit.

sinaiticus.text: And out of the smoke came forth locusts upon the earth, and to them was given power as the scorpions of the earth have power.

verses.text: And out of the smoke came forth locusts upon the earth, and to them was given power as the scorpions of the earth have power.

sinaiticus.text: And it was said to them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing nor any tree, but the men such as have not the seal of God in their foreheads.

verses.text: And it was said to them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing nor any tree, but the men such as have not the seal of God in their foreheads.

sinaiticus.text: And it was given to them that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months; and this torment is as the torment of a scorpion, when he strikes a man.

verses.text: And it was given to them that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months; and this torment is as the torment of a scorpion, when he strikes a man.

sinaiticus.text: And in those days men shall seek death and shall not find it, and they shall desire to die and death flees from them.

verses.text: And in those days men shall seek death and shall not find it, and they shall desire to die and death flees from them.

sinaiticus.text: And the shape of the locusts was like horses prepared for battle, and on their heads as crowns like gold, and; their faces as the faces of men.

verses.text: And the shape of the locusts was like horses prepared for battle, and on their heads as crowns like gold, and; their faces as the faces of men.

sinaiticus.text: and they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as the teeth of lions,

verses.text: and they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as the teeth of lions,

sinaiticus.text: and they had breastplates as breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.

verses.text: and they had breastplates as breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.

sinaiticus.text: And they have tails like scorpions, and stings, and in their tails is their power to hurt men five months:

verses.text: And they have tails like scorpions, and stings, and in their tails is their power to hurt men five months:

sinaiticus.text: they have a king over them, the angel of the abyss, his name in Hebrew is Abaddon, but in Greek he has the name Apollyon.

verses.text: they have a king over them, the angel of the abyss, his name in Hebrew is Abaddon, but in Greek he has the name Apollyon.

sinaiticus.text: The first woe has past: behold, there come two woes more after this.

verses.text: The first woe has past: behold, there come two woes more after this.

sinaiticus.text: And the sixth angel sounded; and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar that is before God,446

verses.text: And the sixth angel sounded; and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar that is before God,446

sinaiticus.text: saying to the sixth angel, that had the trumpet: Loose the four angels that are bound on the great river Euphrates.

verses.text: saying to the sixth angel, that had the trumpet: Loose the four angels that are bound on the great river Euphrates.

sinaiticus.text: And the four angels were loosed, who were prepared for an hour and a day and a month and a year, to slay the third part of men.

verses.text: And the four angels were loosed, who were prepared for an hour and a day and a month and a year, to slay the third part of men.

sinaiticus.text: And the number of the armies of horsemen was two myriads of myriads: I heard the number of them.

verses.text: And the number of the armies of horsemen was two myriads of myriads: I heard the number of them.

sinaiticus.text: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and those that sat on them, having breastplates fiery, hyacinthine, and of sulphur; and the heads of the horses as the heads of lions, and out of their mouths go forth fire and smoke and brimstone.

verses.text: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and those that sat on them, having breastplates fiery, hyacinthine, and of sulphur; and the heads of the horses as the heads of lions, and out of their mouths go forth fire and smoke and brimstone.

sinaiticus.text: By these three plagues was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and the smoke, and the brimstone that went forth out of their mouths.

verses.text: By these three plagues was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and the smoke, and the brimstone that went forth out of their mouths.

sinaiticus.text: For the power of the horses is in their mouth and in their tails; for their tails are like serpents, and have heads, and with them they do hurt.

verses.text: For the power of the horses is in their mouth and in their tails; for their tails are like serpents, and have heads, and with them they do hurt.

sinaiticus.text: And the rest of men, that were not killed by these plagues, repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship demons and idols of gold and of silver and of brass and of stone and of wood, which can neither see, nor hear, nor walk,

verses.text: And the rest of men, that were not killed by these plagues, repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship demons and idols of gold and of silver and of brass and of stone and of wood, which can neither see, nor hear, nor walk,

sinaiticus.text: and they repented not of their murders, neither of their sorceries nor of their lewdness nor of their thefts.

verses.text: and they repented not of their murders, neither of their sorceries nor of their lewdness nor of their thefts.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw another angel that was mighty descending from heaven, clothed with a cloud, and a rainbow was upon his head, and his face was as the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire;

verses.text: And I saw another angel that was mighty descending from heaven, clothed with a cloud, and a rainbow was upon his head, and his face was as the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire;

sinaiticus.text: and he had in his hand a little book opened. And he put his right foot on the sea, but his left on the land,

verses.text: and he had in his hand a little book opened. And he put his right foot on the sea, but his left on the land,

sinaiticus.text: and he cried with a loud voice as a lion roars. And when he had cried, the seven thunders uttered their voices.

verses.text: and he cried with a loud voice as a lion roars. And when he had cried, the seven thunders uttered their voices.

sinaiticus.text: And when the seven thunders had spoken, I was about to write; and I heard a voice from heaven, saying: Seal up the things that the seven thunders spoke, and write them not.

verses.text: And when the seven thunders had spoken, I was about to write; and I heard a voice from heaven, saying: Seal up the things that the seven thunders spoke, and write them not.

sinaiticus.text: And the angel that I saw standing on the sea and on the earth, lifted up his right hand to heaven.

verses.text: And the angel that I saw standing on the sea and on the earth, lifted up his right hand to heaven.

sinaiticus.text: and swore by him that lives from age to age, who created the heaven and the things that are in it, and the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that time should no longer be,

verses.text: and swore by him that lives from age to age, who created the heaven and the things that are in it, and the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that time should no longer be,

sinaiticus.text: but in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall sound, and the mystery of God was finished, as he proclaimed to his

sinaiticus.text: And the voice that I heard from heaven again spoke to me and said: Go, take the little book that is opened in the hand of the angel that stands on the sea and on the earth.

verses.text: And the voice that I heard from heaven again spoke to me and said: Go, take the little book that is opened in the hand of the angel that stands on the sea and on the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And I went to the angel, saying to him that he should give me the little book. And he said to me: Take it and eat it up, and it will make thy belly bitter, but in thy mouth it shall be sweet as honey.

verses.text: And I went to the angel, saying to him that he should give me the little book. And he said to me: Take it and eat it up, and it will make thy belly bitter, but in thy mouth it shall be sweet as honey.

sinaiticus.text: And I took the little book out of the hand of the angel and ate it up; and it was in my mouth as honey, sweet; and when I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.

verses.text: And I took the little book out of the hand of the angel and ate it up; and it was in my mouth as honey, sweet; and when I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.

sinaiticus.text: And they say to me: Thou must again prophesy against many peoples and nations and tongues and kings.

verses.text: And they say to me: Thou must again prophesy against many peoples and nations and tongues and kings.

sinaiticus.text: And there was given me a reed like a rod, saying: Arise and measure the temple of God and the altar and those that worship in it.

verses.text: And there was given me a reed like a rod, saying: Arise and measure the temple of God and the altar and those that worship in it.

sinaiticus.text: And the court that is without the temple leave out and measure it not, for it is given to the Gentiles, and the holy city shall they tread down forty-two months.

verses.text: And the court that is without the temple leave out and measure it not, for it is given to the Gentiles, and the holy city shall they tread down forty-two months.

sinaiticus.text: And I will give to my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and sixty days, clothed in sackcloth.

verses.text: And I will give to my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and sixty days, clothed in sackcloth.

sinaiticus.text: These are the two olive-trees and the two candlesticks that stand before the Lord of the earth.

verses.text: These are the two olive-trees and the two candlesticks that stand before the Lord of the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And if any one will hurt them, fire comes forth from their mouth and devours their enemies; and if any one will hurt them, they must be put to death.

verses.text: And if any one will hurt them, fire comes forth from their mouth and devours their enemies; and if any one will hurt them, they must be put to death.

sinaiticus.text: These have authority to shut heaven, that rain fall not in the days of their prophecy, and they have authority over the waters to turn them into blood, and to smite the earth with every plague as often as they will.

verses.text: These have authority to shut heaven, that rain fall not in the days of their prophecy, and they have authority over the waters to turn them into blood, and to smite the earth with every plague as often as they will.

sinaiticus.text: And when they shall have accomplished their testimony, the beast that ascends out of the abyss shall make war with them and overcome them and kill them.

verses.text: And when they shall have accomplished their testimony, the beast that ascends out of the abyss shall make war with them and overcome them and kill them.

sinaiticus.text: And their dead bodies* in the street of the great city, which is called, spiritually, Sodom and Egypt, where our Lord also was crucified. *No verb in Greek: perhaps “suspended” is best…

verses.text: And their dead bodies* in the street of the great city, which is called, spiritually, Sodom and Egypt, where our Lord also was crucified. *No verb in Greek: perhaps “suspended” is best…

sinaiticus.text: And they of the peoples and tribes and tongues and nations see their dead bodies three days and a half, and suffer not their dead bodies to be put into a tomb.

verses.text: And they of the peoples and tribes and tongues and nations see their dead bodies three days and a half, and suffer not their dead bodies to be put into a tomb.

sinaiticus.text: And they that dwell on the earth rejoice over them and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another, because these two prophets tormented them that dwell on the earth.448

verses.text: And they that dwell on the earth rejoice over them and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another, because these two prophets tormented them that dwell on the earth.448

sinaiticus.text: And after three days and a half the spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet, and great fear fell upon those that saw them.

verses.text: And after three days and a half the spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet, and great fear fell upon those that saw them.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a great voice out of heaven saying to them: Come up hither; and they went up into heaven in a cloud, and their enemies beheld them.

verses.text: And I heard a great voice out of heaven saying to them: Come up hither; and they went up into heaven in a cloud, and their enemies beheld them.

sinaiticus.text: And in that hour there was a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and there were killed in the earthquake names of men seven thousand, and the rest were frightened and gave glory to the God of heaven.

verses.text: And in that hour there was a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and there were killed in the earthquake names of men seven thousand, and the rest were frightened and gave glory to the God of heaven.

sinaiticus.text: The second woe was passed: the third woe, behold, it comes quickly.

verses.text: The second woe was passed: the third woe, behold, it comes quickly.

sinaiticus.text: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying: The kingdom of the world has become our Lord’s and his Christ’s, and he shall reign from age to age.

verses.text: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying: The kingdom of the world has become our Lord’s and his Christ’s, and he shall reign from age to age.

sinaiticus.text: And the twenty-four elders that sat on their thrones before God fell on their faces and worshipped God,

verses.text: And the twenty-four elders that sat on their thrones before God fell on their faces and worshipped God,

sinaiticus.text: saying: We give thee thanks. Lord God, the Almighty who art and who wast, because thou hast taken thy great power and hast reigned;

verses.text: saying: We give thee thanks. Lord God, the Almighty who art and who wast, because thou hast taken thy great power and hast reigned;

sinaiticus.text: and the nations were angry, and thy wrath has come, and the time of the dead that they should be judged, and that thou shouldst give reward to thy servants the prophets and to thy saints and to those that fear thy name, both small and great, and that thou shouldst destroy those that destroy the earth.

verses.text: and the nations were angry, and thy wrath has come, and the time of the dead that they should be judged, and that thou shouldst give reward to thy servants the prophets and to thy saints and to those that fear thy name, both small and great, and that thou shouldst destroy those that destroy the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there appeared in his temple the ark of his covenant, and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.

verses.text: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there appeared in his temple the ark of his covenant, and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.

sinaiticus.text: And a great sign appeared in heaven, a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars;

verses.text: And a great sign appeared in heaven, a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars;

sinaiticus.text: and being with child she cried, being in travail and in pain to be delivered.

verses.text: and being with child she cried, being in travail and in pain to be delivered.

verses.text: And there appeared another sign in heaven, and behold, a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his head seven diadems,

sinaiticus.text: and his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman that was about to be delivered, that when she brought forth her child he might devour it.

sinaiticus.text: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and sixty days.

verses.text: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and sixty days.

sinaiticus.text: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels went forth to war with the dragon. And the dragon fought and his angels,

verses.text: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels went forth to war with the dragon. And the dragon fought and his angels,

sinaiticus.text: and prevailed not, neither was their place found any more in heaven.

verses.text: and prevailed not, neither was their place found any more in heaven.

sinaiticus.text: And the great dragon was cast out, the old serpent, that is called devil and Satan, that deceives the whole world; he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.

verses.text: And the great dragon was cast out, the old serpent, that is called devil and Satan, that deceives the whole world; he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a great voice in heaven, saying: Now has come the salvation, and the power, and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ, for the accuser of our brethren has been cast out, he that accused them before our God day and night.

verses.text: And I heard a great voice in heaven, saying: Now has come the salvation, and the power, and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ, for the accuser of our brethren has been cast out, he that accused them before our God day and night.

sinaiticus.text: And they overcame him because of the blood of the Lamb and because of the word of their testimony, and they loved not their lives to their death.

verses.text: And they overcame him because of the blood of the Lamb and because of the word of their testimony, and they loved not their lives to their death.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore rejoice, you heavens and those that dwell in them: alas for the earth and the sea, for the devil has come down to you having great wrath, knowing that he has a short time.

verses.text: Therefore rejoice, you heavens and those that dwell in them: alas for the earth and the sea, for the devil has come down to you having great wrath, knowing that he has a short time.

sinaiticus.text: And when the dragon saw that he was cast out into the earth, he persecuted the woman who had brought forth the man-child.

verses.text: And when the dragon saw that he was cast out into the earth, he persecuted the woman who had brought forth the man-child.

sinaiticus.text: And there were given to the woman two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness to her place, where she is nourished for a time and times and half a time from the face of the serpent.

verses.text: And there were given to the woman two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness to her place, where she is nourished for a time and times and half a time from the face of the serpent.

sinaiticus.text: And the serpent cast out of his mouth after the woman water as a river, that he might carry her away with a flood.

verses.text: And the serpent cast out of his mouth after the woman water as a river, that he might carry her away with a flood.

sinaiticus.text: And the earth helped the woman; and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the river that the dragon threw out of his mouth.

verses.text: And the earth helped the woman; and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the river that the dragon threw out of his mouth.

sinaiticus.text: And the dragon was angry with the woman, and went away to make war with the rest of her children, that keep the commandments of God, and that hold the testimony of Jesus.

verses.text: And the dragon was angry with the woman, and went away to make war with the rest of her children, that keep the commandments of God, and that hold the testimony of Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: And I stood on the sand of the sea, and saw a beast coming up out of the sea, and he had seven heads and ten horns, and on his horns ten diadems, and on his heads names impiously irreverent.

verses.text: And I stood on the sand of the sea, and saw a beast coming up out of the sea, and he had seven heads and ten horns, and on his horns ten diadems, and on his heads names impiously irreverent.

sinaiticus.text: And the beast that I saw was like a leopard, and his feet were as those of a bear, and his mouth was as the mouth of a lion. And the dragon gave him his power, and his throne, and great authority.450

verses.text: And the beast that I saw was like a leopard, and his feet were as those of a bear, and his mouth was as the mouth of a lion. And the dragon gave him his power, and his throne, and great authority.450

sinaiticus.text: And I saw one of his heads as if it had been wounded even to death; and his deadly wound was healed; and all the earth wondered after the beast.

verses.text: And I saw one of his heads as if it had been wounded even to death; and his deadly wound was healed; and all the earth wondered after the beast.

sinaiticus.text: And they worshipped the dragon, because he gave authority to the beast; and they worshipped the beast, saying, Who is like the beast? and, Who is able to make war with him?

verses.text: And they worshipped the dragon, because he gave authority to the beast; and they worshipped the beast, saying, Who is like the beast? and, Who is able to make war with him?

sinaiticus.text: And there was given him a mouth that spoke great things and impious words; and authority was given to him to continue forty-two months.

verses.text: And there was given him a mouth that spoke great things and impious words; and authority was given to him to continue forty-two months.

sinaiticus.text: And he opened his mouth in impious speeches against God, to utter impious words against his name, and his tabernacle, and against those who dwell in heaven.

verses.text: And he opened his mouth in impious speeches against God, to utter impious words against his name, and his tabernacle, and against those who dwell in heaven.

sinaiticus.text: And it was given him to make war with the saints, and to overcome them; and authority was given him over every tribe and people and tongue and nation.

verses.text: And it was given him to make war with the saints, and to overcome them; and authority was given him over every tribe and people and tongue and nation.

sinaiticus.text: And all that dwell upon the earth will worship him, those whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb that was slain from the foundation of the world.

verses.text: And all that dwell upon the earth will worship him, those whose names are not written in the book of life of the Lamb that was slain from the foundation of the world.

sinaiticus.text: If any one has an ear, let him hear.

verses.text: If any one has an ear, let him hear.

sinaiticus.text: If any one leads into captivity, he shall go into captivity. If any kills with the sword, he must be killed with the sword. Here is the patience and faithfulness of the saints.

verses.text: If any one leads into captivity, he shall go into captivity. If any kills with the sword, he must be killed with the sword. Here is the patience and faithfulness of the saints.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw another beast coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns like a lamb, and he spoke as a dragon.

verses.text: And I saw another beast coming up out of the earth; and he had two horns like a lamb, and he spoke as a dragon.

sinaiticus.text: And he exercises all the authority of the first beast in his presence; and he causes the earth and those who dwell in it to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.

verses.text: And he exercises all the authority of the first beast in his presence; and he causes the earth and those who dwell in it to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.

sinaiticus.text: And he does great signs, and even causes fire to descend from heaven upon the earth in the sight of men.

verses.text: And he does great signs, and even causes fire to descend from heaven upon the earth in the sight of men.

sinaiticus.text: And he deceives those who dwell on the earth, by means of the signs which he is allowed to do in the presence of the beast, saying to those who dwell on the earth, that they should make an image for the beast which had the wound by the sword, and did live.

verses.text: And he deceives those who dwell on the earth, by means of the signs which he is allowed to do in the presence of the beast, saying to those who dwell on the earth, that they should make an image for the beast which had the wound by the sword, and did live.

sinaiticus.text: And it was granted him to give spirit to the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause as many as would not worship the image of the beast, to be killed.

verses.text: And it was granted him to give spirit to the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause as many as would not worship the image of the beast, to be killed.

sinaiticus.text: And he causes all, small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark on their right hand, or on their forehead,

verses.text: And he causes all, small and great, rich and poor, free and bond, to receive a mark on their right hand, or on their forehead,

sinaiticus.text: and that no one should be able to buy or sell, but he that had the mark, the name of the beast, or the number of his name.

verses.text: and that no one should be able to buy or sell, but he that had the mark, the name of the beast, or the number of his name.
