sinaiticus.text: And I saw, and behold, the Lamb stood on the mount Zion, and with him a hundred and forty-four thousand, that had his name and his Father’s name written in their foreheads.

verses.text: And I saw, and behold, the Lamb stood on the mount Zion, and with him a hundred and forty-four thousand, that had his name and his Father’s name written in their foreheads.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a voice from heaven like the voice of many waters, and like the voice of loud thunder; and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps.

verses.text: And I heard a voice from heaven like the voice of many waters, and like the voice of loud thunder; and I heard the voice of harpers harping with their harps.

sinaiticus.text: And they sung a new song before the throne, and before the four living creatures, and the elders; and no one was able to learn the song, but the hundred and forty-four thousand that had been redeemed from the earth.

verses.text: And they sung a new song before the throne, and before the four living creatures, and the elders; and no one was able to learn the song, but the hundred and forty-four thousand that had been redeemed from the earth.

sinaiticus.text: These are they that were not defiled with women; for they are virgins; these are they that follow the Lamb wherever he goes; these were redeemed from among men, the first-fruits to God and to the Lamb.

verses.text: These are they that were not defiled with women; for they are virgins; these are they that follow the Lamb wherever he goes; these were redeemed from among men, the first-fruits to God and to the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: And in their mouth was found no guile; for they are blameless.

verses.text: And in their mouth was found no guile; for they are blameless.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw another angel flying in mid-heaven, having the eternal gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth, even to every nation and tribe and tongue and people;

verses.text: And I saw another angel flying in mid-heaven, having the eternal gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth, even to every nation and tribe and tongue and people;

sinaiticus.text: and he said with a loud voice: Fear God, and give glory to him for the hour of his judgment has come; and worship him that made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.

verses.text: and he said with a loud voice: Fear God, and give glory to him for the hour of his judgment has come; and worship him that made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.

sinaiticus.text: And another angel followed, saying: Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen: because she has made all nations drink of the maddening wine of her lewdness.

verses.text: And another angel followed, saying: Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen: because she has made all nations drink of the maddening wine of her lewdness.

sinaiticus.text: And the third angel followed them, saying, with a loud voice: If any one worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or on his hand, even he shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is prepared without mixture in the cup of his indignation;

verses.text: And the third angel followed them, saying, with a loud voice: If any one worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or on his hand, even he shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is prepared without mixture in the cup of his indignation;

sinaiticus.text: and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb;

verses.text: and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb;

sinaiticus.text: and the smoke of their torment ascends from age to age; and they who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name, have no rest day or night.

verses.text: and the smoke of their torment ascends from age to age; and they who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name, have no rest day or night.

sinaiticus.text: Here is the patience of the saints, who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.

verses.text: Here is the patience of the saints, who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a voice from heaven, saying: Write, Blessed are the dead that die in the Lord from this time. Yes, says the Spirit, that they may rest from their labors, and their works do follow them.

verses.text: And I heard a voice from heaven, saying: Write, Blessed are the dead that die in the Lord from this time. Yes, says the Spirit, that they may rest from their labors, and their works do follow them.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw, and behold, a white cloud, and on the cloud sat one like the Son of man, who had on his head a crown of gold, and in his hand a sharp sickle.452

verses.text: And I saw, and behold, a white cloud, and on the cloud sat one like the Son of man, who had on his head a crown of gold, and in his hand a sharp sickle.452

sinaiticus.text: And another angel came out of the temple, and cried with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud: Thrust in your sickle and reap, for the time has come for you to reap; for the harvest of the earth is fully ripe.

verses.text: And another angel came out of the temple, and cried with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud: Thrust in your sickle and reap, for the time has come for you to reap; for the harvest of the earth is fully ripe.

sinaiticus.text: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped.

verses.text: And he that sat on the cloud thrust in his sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped.

sinaiticus.text: And another angel came out of the temple that is in heaven, and he also had a sharp sickle.

verses.text: And another angel came out of the temple that is in heaven, and he also had a sharp sickle.

sinaiticus.text: And another angel that had power over fire, came out from the altar; and he cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, and said: Thrust in your sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for its grapes are fully ripe.

verses.text: And another angel that had power over fire, came out from the altar; and he cried with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, and said: Thrust in your sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for its grapes are fully ripe.

sinaiticus.text: And the angel thrust in his sickle on the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and threw it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.

verses.text: And the angel thrust in his sickle on the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and threw it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.

sinaiticus.text: And the winepress was trodden without the city; and blood came out of the winepress, even to the bridles of the horses, to the distance of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.

verses.text: And the winepress was trodden without the city; and blood came out of the winepress, even to the bridles of the horses, to the distance of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and wonderful: seven angels that had seven plagues which are the last; for by them the wrath of God is brought to an end.

verses.text: And I saw another sign in heaven, great and wonderful: seven angels that had seven plagues which are the last; for by them the wrath of God is brought to an end.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw, as it were, a sea of glass mingled with fire, and those who had obtained the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.

verses.text: And I saw, as it were, a sea of glass mingled with fire, and those who had obtained the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass, having the harps of God.

sinaiticus.text: And they sung the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying: Great and wonderful are thy works, Lord God Almighty; just and true are thy ways, thou King of saints.

verses.text: And they sung the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying: Great and wonderful are thy works, Lord God Almighty; just and true are thy ways, thou King of saints.

sinaiticus.text: Who will not fear thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name? For thou alone art holy; for all nations shall come and worship before thee, because thy judgments are made manifest.

verses.text: Who will not fear thee, O Lord, and glorify thy name? For thou alone art holy; for all nations shall come and worship before thee, because thy judgments are made manifest.

sinaiticus.text: And after this I saw, and the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened;

verses.text: And after this I saw, and the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened;

sinaiticus.text: and the seven angels that had the seven plagues came out of the temple, clothed in pure white linen, and girded about the breasts with golden girdles.

verses.text: and the seven angels that had the seven plagues came out of the temple, clothed in pure white linen, and girded about the breasts with golden girdles.

verses.text: And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden cups full of the wrath of God, who lives from age to age.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a great voice out of the temple, saying to the seven angels: Go and pour out the seven cups of the wrath of God upon the earth.

verses.text: And I heard a great voice out of the temple, saying to the seven angels: Go and pour out the seven cups of the wrath of God upon the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And the first angel went, and poured out his cup on the land; and there came a hurtful and afflictive sore upon the men that had the mark of the beast, and that worshiped his image.

verses.text: And the first angel went, and poured out his cup on the land; and there came a hurtful and afflictive sore upon the men that had the mark of the beast, and that worshiped his image.

sinaiticus.text: And the second angel poured out his cup on the sea; and it became blood, like that of a dead man; and every soul in the sea died.

verses.text: And the second angel poured out his cup on the sea; and it became blood, like that of a dead man; and every soul in the sea died.

sinaiticus.text: And the third angel poured out his cup on the rivers and the fountains of waters; and they became blood.

verses.text: And the third angel poured out his cup on the rivers and the fountains of waters; and they became blood.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard the angel of the waters, saying: Just art thou, who art and who wast, the Holy One, because thou hast thus judged.

verses.text: And I heard the angel of the waters, saying: Just art thou, who art and who wast, the Holy One, because thou hast thus judged.

sinaiticus.text: For they have shed the blood of saints and of prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink, and they are worthy.

verses.text: For they have shed the blood of saints and of prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink, and they are worthy.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a voice from the altar saying: Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and just are thy judgments.

verses.text: And I heard a voice from the altar saying: Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and just are thy judgments.

verses.text: And the fourth angel poured out his cup on the sun; and it was given to him to scorch men with fire.

sinaiticus.text: And men were scorched with great heat; and they uttered impious words against the name of God who has power over these plagues; and they repented not, that they might give him glory.

verses.text: And men were scorched with great heat; and they uttered impious words against the name of God who has power over these plagues; and they repented not, that they might give him glory.

sinaiticus.text: And the fifth angel poured out his cup on the throne of the beast; and his kingdom was filled with darkness; and they gnawed their tongues because of pain;

verses.text: And the fifth angel poured out his cup on the throne of the beast; and his kingdom was filled with darkness; and they gnawed their tongues because of pain;

sinaiticus.text: and they spoke impiously against the God of heaven because of their pains, and because of their sores; and they repented not of their works.

verses.text: and they spoke impiously against the God of heaven because of their pains, and because of their sores; and they repented not of their works.

sinaiticus.text: And the sixth angel poured out his cup on the great river Euphrates; and its water was dried up, that the way of the kings of the east might be prepared.

verses.text: And the sixth angel poured out his cup on the great river Euphrates; and its water was dried up, that the way of the kings of the east might be prepared.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw three unclean spirits, like frogs, come out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast; and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

verses.text: And I saw three unclean spirits, like frogs, come out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast; and out of the mouth of the false prophet.

sinaiticus.text: For they are the spirits of demons that do signs, and they go forth to the kings of the whole world, to bring them together to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.

verses.text: For they are the spirits of demons that do signs, and they go forth to the kings of the whole world, to bring them together to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, I come as a thief: blessed is he that watches, and keeps his garments, that he may not walk naked, and that men may not see his nakedness.

verses.text: Behold, I come as a thief: blessed is he that watches, and keeps his garments, that he may not walk naked, and that men may not see his nakedness.

sinaiticus.text: And they brought them together into a place that is called, in the Hebrew tongue, Armageddon.454

verses.text: And they brought them together into a place that is called, in the Hebrew tongue, Armageddon.454

sinaiticus.text: And the seventh angel poured out his cup into the air; and there came a great voice from the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying: It is done.

verses.text: And the seventh angel poured out his cup into the air; and there came a great voice from the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying: It is done.

sinaiticus.text: And there were lightnings, and voices, and thunders; and there was a great earthquake, such as has not been since men were on the earth, so great an earthquake, and so mighty.

verses.text: And there were lightnings, and voices, and thunders; and there was a great earthquake, such as has not been since men were on the earth, so great an earthquake, and so mighty.

sinaiticus.text: And the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell; and Babylon the great was remembered before God, that he might give her the cup of the wine of his fiercest wrath.

verses.text: And the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell; and Babylon the great was remembered before God, that he might give her the cup of the wine of his fiercest wrath.

sinaiticus.text: And every island fled, and the mountains were not found.

verses.text: And every island fled, and the mountains were not found.

sinaiticus.text: And great hail, every stone about the weight of a talent, fell from heaven upon men; and men spoke impiously against God, because of the plague of the hail; for the plague of it was very great.

verses.text: And great hail, every stone about the weight of a talent, fell from heaven upon men; and men spoke impiously against God, because of the plague of the hail; for the plague of it was very great.

sinaiticus.text: with whom the kings of the earth have practiced lewdness, and with the wine of whose lewdness the inhabitants of the earth have been made drunk.

verses.text: with whom the kings of the earth have practiced lewdness, and with the wine of whose lewdness the inhabitants of the earth have been made drunk.

sinaiticus.text: And he carried me, away in spirit into the wilderness; and I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast, that was full of impious names, and that had seven heads and ten horns.

verses.text: And he carried me, away in spirit into the wilderness; and I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast, that was full of impious names, and that had seven heads and ten horns.

sinaiticus.text: And the woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold, and precious stones, and pearls; and she had in her hand a golden cup full of idolatrous pollutions, and the impurities of her lewdness.

verses.text: And the woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold, and precious stones, and pearls; and she had in her hand a golden cup full of idolatrous pollutions, and the impurities of her lewdness.

sinaiticus.text: And on her forehead was a name written: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS, AND OF THE IDOLATROUS POLLUTIONS OF THE EARTH.

verses.text: And on her forehead was a name written: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS, AND OF THE IDOLATROUS POLLUTIONS OF THE EARTH.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus; and when I saw her, I wondered with great astonishment.

verses.text: And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus; and when I saw her, I wondered with great astonishment.

sinaiticus.text: And the angel said to me: Why did you wonder? I will tell you the mystery of the woman, and of the beast that carries her, that had seven heads and ten horns.

verses.text: And the angel said to me: Why did you wonder? I will tell you the mystery of the woman, and of the beast that carries her, that had seven heads and ten horns.

sinaiticus.text: The beast that you saw, was, and is not, and will come out of the abyss, and go to perdition; and those who dwell on the earth, whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, will wonder, when they see the beast that was, and is not, though he is yet present.

verses.text: The beast that you saw, was, and is not, and will come out of the abyss, and go to perdition; and those who dwell on the earth, whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, will wonder, when they see the beast that was, and is not, though he is yet present.

sinaiticus.text: Here is the mind that has wisdom: The seven heads are seven

verses.text: Here is the mind that has wisdom: The seven heads are seven

sinaiticus.text: And there are seven kings: five have fallen, one is, and the other has not yet come; and when he comes, he must remain but a little while.

verses.text: And there are seven kings: five have fallen, one is, and the other has not yet come; and when he comes, he must remain but a little while.

sinaiticus.text: And the beast that was, and is not, even he is the eighth, and is of the seven, and goes to perdition.

verses.text: And the beast that was, and is not, even he is the eighth, and is of the seven, and goes to perdition.

sinaiticus.text: And the ten horns which you saw are ten kings, who have received no kingdom as yet, but receive authority as kings at the same time with the beast.

verses.text: And the ten horns which you saw are ten kings, who have received no kingdom as yet, but receive authority as kings at the same time with the beast.

sinaiticus.text: These have one mind, and will give their power and authority to the beast.

verses.text: These have one mind, and will give their power and authority to the beast.

sinaiticus.text: These will make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb will overcome them, for he is Lord of lords, and King of kings; and those with him are called, and chosen, and faithful.

verses.text: These will make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb will overcome them, for he is Lord of lords, and King of kings; and those with him are called, and chosen, and faithful.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: The waters which you saw, where the harlot sits, are peoples and multitudes and nations and tongues.

verses.text: And he said to me: The waters which you saw, where the harlot sits, are peoples and multitudes and nations and tongues.

sinaiticus.text: And the ten horns that you saw, and the beast, these will hate the harlot, and will make her desolate and naked, and will eat her flesh, and burn her up with fire.

verses.text: And the ten horns that you saw, and the beast, these will hate the harlot, and will make her desolate and naked, and will eat her flesh, and burn her up with fire.

sinaiticus.text: For God has put into their hearts to fulfill his will, and to agree, and to give their kingdom to the beast, till the words of God be accomplished.

verses.text: For God has put into their hearts to fulfill his will, and to agree, and to give their kingdom to the beast, till the words of God be accomplished.

sinaiticus.text: And the woman that you saw is that great city, which reigns over the kings of the earth.

verses.text: And the woman that you saw is that great city, which reigns over the kings of the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And after these things I saw another angel come down from heaven, having great power; and the earth was lighted with his glory.

verses.text: And after these things I saw another angel come down from heaven, having great power; and the earth was lighted with his glory.

sinaiticus.text: And he cried with a strong voice, saying: Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen, and has become the habitation of demons, and the haunt of every unclean spirit, and the resort of every unclean and hateful bird.

verses.text: And he cried with a strong voice, saying: Babylon the great has fallen, has fallen, and has become the habitation of demons, and the haunt of every unclean spirit, and the resort of every unclean and hateful bird.

sinaiticus.text: For she has made all nations drink of the maddening wine of her lewdness; and the kings of the earth have practiced lewdness with her, and the merchants of the earth have become rich by the power of her voluptuousness.

verses.text: For she has made all nations drink of the maddening wine of her lewdness; and the kings of the earth have practiced lewdness with her, and the merchants of the earth have become rich by the power of her voluptuousness.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard another voice from heaven, saying: Come out of her, my people, lest you become partakers of her sins, and lest you receive of her plagues.

verses.text: And I heard another voice from heaven, saying: Come out of her, my people, lest you become partakers of her sins, and lest you receive of her plagues.

sinaiticus.text: For her sins reach even to heaven, and God has remembered her iniquities.

verses.text: For her sins reach even to heaven, and God has remembered her iniquities.

sinaiticus.text: Reward her as she has rewarded you, and render back to her double, according to her works; in the cup that she has mixed, mix for her double.456

verses.text: Reward her as she has rewarded you, and render back to her double, according to her works; in the cup that she has mixed, mix for her double.456

sinaiticus.text: As much glory and voluptuousness as she has given to herself, so much torment and sorrow give her; for she says in her heart, I sit a queen, and am no widow, and shall see no sorrow.

verses.text: As much glory and voluptuousness as she has given to herself, so much torment and sorrow give her; for she says in her heart, I sit a queen, and am no widow, and shall see no sorrow.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, her plagues shall come in one day, death and mourning and famine; and she shall be utterly burned with fire; for strong is the Lord God who judges her,

verses.text: Therefore, her plagues shall come in one day, death and mourning and famine; and she shall be utterly burned with fire; for strong is the Lord God who judges her,

sinaiticus.text: And the kings of the earth. who have practiced lewdness and lived voluptuously with her, shall weep and lament for her, when they see the smoke of her burning

verses.text: And the kings of the earth. who have practiced lewdness and lived voluptuously with her, shall weep and lament for her, when they see the smoke of her burning

sinaiticus.text: standing far off for fear of her torment, saying: Alas, alas, that great city of Babylon, that mighty city: for in one hour has your judgment come.

verses.text: standing far off for fear of her torment, saying: Alas, alas, that great city of Babylon, that mighty city: for in one hour has your judgment come.

sinaiticus.text: And the merchants of the earth shall weep and lament over her, because no one buys their merchandise any more;

verses.text: And the merchants of the earth shall weep and lament over her, because no one buys their merchandise any more;

sinaiticus.text: the merchandise of gold and silver and precious stones, and of pearls, and of fine linen and purple, and of silk and scarlet; and every kind of thiyine wood, and every kind of vessel of ivory, and every kind of vessel of most costly wood, and of brass, and of iron, and of marble;

verses.text: the merchandise of gold and silver and precious stones, and of pearls, and of fine linen and purple, and of silk and scarlet; and every kind of thiyine wood, and every kind of vessel of ivory, and every kind of vessel of most costly wood, and of brass, and of iron, and of marble;

sinaiticus.text: and cinnamon and amomum and incense, and ointment and frankincense, and wine and oil, and fine flour and wheat, and beasts and sheep, and horses and chariots, and bodies and souls of men.

verses.text: and cinnamon and amomum and incense, and ointment and frankincense, and wine and oil, and fine flour and wheat, and beasts and sheep, and horses and chariots, and bodies and souls of men.

sinaiticus.text: And the fruits that your soul desired have departed from you: and all things that are dainty and sumptuous have perished from you and you shall find them no more at all.

verses.text: And the fruits that your soul desired have departed from you: and all things that are dainty and sumptuous have perished from you and you shall find them no more at all.

sinaiticus.text: Those who traded in these things, who were made rich by her, shall stand far off for fear of her torment, weeping and mourning and

verses.text: Those who traded in these things, who were made rich by her, shall stand far off for fear of her torment, weeping and mourning and

sinaiticus.text: saying: Alas, alas, that great city that was clothed in fine linen and purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls! for in one hour, so great riches have been brought to ruin.

verses.text: saying: Alas, alas, that great city that was clothed in fine linen and purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls! for in one hour, so great riches have been brought to ruin.

sinaiticus.text: And every master of a ship, and every one in ships, and sailors, and as many as trade by sea, stood far off,

verses.text: And every master of a ship, and every one in ships, and sailors, and as many as trade by sea, stood far off,

sinaiticus.text: and cried, when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying: What city is like the great city?

verses.text: and cried, when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying: What city is like the great city?

sinaiticus.text: And they threw dust on their heads, and cried, weeping and mourning and saying: Alas, alas, that great city, by which all that had ships in the sea became rich by means of costly merchandise for in one hour she is made desolate.

verses.text: And they threw dust on their heads, and cried, weeping and mourning and saying: Alas, alas, that great city, by which all that had ships in the sea became rich by means of costly merchandise for in one hour she is made desolate.

sinaiticus.text: Rejoice over her, O heaven, and you saints and apostles and prophets; for God has avenged you on her.

verses.text: Rejoice over her, O heaven, and you saints and apostles and prophets; for God has avenged you on her.

sinaiticus.text: And a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone, and threw it into the sea, saying: Thus, with violence shall Babylon, that

verses.text: And a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone, and threw it into the sea, saying: Thus, with violence shall Babylon, that

sinaiticus.text: And the voice of harpers and musicians, and of pipers and trumpeters, shall be heard no more at all in you; and no artist of any art whatever, shall he found any more in you; and the sound of the millstone shall be heard no more in you;

verses.text: And the voice of harpers and musicians, and of pipers and trumpeters, shall be heard no more at all in you; and no artist of any art whatever, shall he found any more in you; and the sound of the millstone shall be heard no more in you;

sinaiticus.text: and the light of a lamp shall shine no more in you; and the voice of the bridegroom and of the bride shall be heard no more in you; for your merchants were the great men of the earth; for by your sorcery were all nations deceived.

verses.text: and the light of a lamp shall shine no more in you; and the voice of the bridegroom and of the bride shall be heard no more in you; for your merchants were the great men of the earth; for by your sorcery were all nations deceived.

sinaiticus.text: And in her was found the blood of prophets and of saints, and of all that were slain upon the earth.

verses.text: And in her was found the blood of prophets and of saints, and of all that were slain upon the earth.

sinaiticus.text: After these things, I heard the great voice of a vast multitude in heaven, saying: Alleluia; Salvation and glory and honor and power to our God;

verses.text: After these things, I heard the great voice of a vast multitude in heaven, saying: Alleluia; Salvation and glory and honor and power to our God;

sinaiticus.text: for true and righteous are his judgments, for he has judged the great harlot that corrupted the earth with her lewdness; and he has avenged the blood of his servant at her hand.

verses.text: for true and righteous are his judgments, for he has judged the great harlot that corrupted the earth with her lewdness; and he has avenged the blood of his servant at her hand.

sinaiticus.text: And again they said: Alleluia; and her smoke rises up from age-to age.

verses.text: And again they said: Alleluia; and her smoke rises up from age-to age.

sinaiticus.text: And the twenty-four elders, and the four living creatures, fell down, and worshiped God that sits upon the throne, saying: Amen, Alleluia.

verses.text: And the twenty-four elders, and the four living creatures, fell down, and worshiped God that sits upon the throne, saying: Amen, Alleluia.

sinaiticus.text: And a voice came out of the throne, saying: Praise our God, all you his servants, and you that fear him, both small and great.

verses.text: And a voice came out of the throne, saying: Praise our God, all you his servants, and you that fear him, both small and great.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of mighty thunderings, saying: Alleluia; for the Lord God, the Almighty reigns.

verses.text: And I heard as it were the voice of a great multitude, and as the voice of many waters, and as the voice of mighty thunderings, saying: Alleluia; for the Lord God, the Almighty reigns.

sinaiticus.text: Let us rejoice and be glad, and give glory to him; for the marriage of the Lamb has come, and his wife has made herself ready.

verses.text: Let us rejoice and be glad, and give glory to him; for the marriage of the Lamb has come, and his wife has made herself ready.

sinaiticus.text: And to her was given that she should be clothed in fine linen, clean and white; for the fine linen is the righteousness of the saints.

verses.text: And to her was given that she should be clothed in fine linen, clean and white; for the fine linen is the righteousness of the saints.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: Write, Blessed are they that are called to the marriage-supper of the Lamb. And he said to me: These are the true words of God.

verses.text: And he said to me: Write, Blessed are they that are called to the marriage-supper of the Lamb. And he said to me: These are the true words of God.

sinaiticus.text: And I fell at his feet to worship him; and he said to me: See that you do it not; I am your fellow-servant, and of your brethren that have the testimony of Jesus; worship God; for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

verses.text: And I fell at his feet to worship him; and he said to me: See that you do it not; I am your fellow-servant, and of your brethren that have the testimony of Jesus; worship God; for the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and he that sat on him was called faithful and true, and in righteousness does he judge, and make war.

verses.text: And I saw heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and he that sat on him was called faithful and true, and in righteousness does he judge, and make war.

sinaiticus.text: His eyes were like a flame of fire, and on his head were many diadems: and he had a name written which no one knew, but he himself.458

verses.text: His eyes were like a flame of fire, and on his head were many diadems: and he had a name written which no one knew, but he himself.458

sinaiticus.text: And he was clothed with a garment dipped in blood; and his name is called The Word of God.

verses.text: And he was clothed with a garment dipped in blood; and his name is called The Word of God.

sinaiticus.text: And the armies that were in heaven followed him on white horses; and they were clothed in fine linen, white and clean.

verses.text: And the armies that were in heaven followed him on white horses; and they were clothed in fine linen, white and clean.

sinaiticus.text: And out of his mouth goes a sharp, two-edged sword, that with it he may smite the nations; and he shall rule them with a rod of iron; and he treads the winepress of the fiercest wrath of God, the Almighty.

verses.text: And out of his mouth goes a sharp, two-edged sword, that with it he may smite the nations; and he shall rule them with a rod of iron; and he treads the winepress of the fiercest wrath of God, the Almighty.

sinaiticus.text: And he has, on his raiment and on his thigh, a name written, King of kings, and Lord of lords.

verses.text: And he has, on his raiment and on his thigh, a name written, King of kings, and Lord of lords.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in mid-heaven: Come, gather yourselves to the great supper of God,

verses.text: And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in mid-heaven: Come, gather yourselves to the great supper of God,

sinaiticus.text: that you may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of officers, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses, and of those who sit on them. and the flesh of all, both freemen and servants, both small and great.

verses.text: that you may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of officers, and the flesh of mighty men, and the flesh of horses, and of those who sit on them. and the flesh of all, both freemen and servants, both small and great.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies, assembled together to make war with him that sat on the horse, and with his army.

verses.text: And I saw the beast, and the kings of the earth, and their armies, assembled together to make war with him that sat on the horse, and with his army.

sinaiticus.text: And the beast was taken, and the false prophet that was with him, who did signs in his presence, with which he deceived those who received the mark of the beast, and those who worshiped his image. These two were thrown alive into the lake of fire, which burns with brimstone.

verses.text: And the beast was taken, and the false prophet that was with him, who did signs in his presence, with which he deceived those who received the mark of the beast, and those who worshiped his image. These two were thrown alive into the lake of fire, which burns with brimstone.

sinaiticus.text: And the rest were slain with the sword of him that sat on the horse, which sword proceeded out of his mouth: and all the birds were filled with their flesh.

verses.text: And the rest were slain with the sword of him that sat on the horse, which sword proceeded out of his mouth: and all the birds were filled with their flesh.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw angel come down from heaven, having the key of the abyss, and a great chain in his hand.

verses.text: And I saw angel come down from heaven, having the key of the abyss, and a great chain in his hand.

sinaiticus.text: And he laid hold of the dragon, that old serpent, which is the devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years,

verses.text: And he laid hold of the dragon, that old serpent, which is the devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years,

sinaiticus.text: and threw him into the abyss, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he should deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years should be completed; and after this he must be loosed for a little while.

verses.text: and threw him into the abyss, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he should deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years should be completed; and after this he must be loosed for a little while.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed and holy is he that has part in this first resurrection; over such the second death has no power; but they shall be priests of God and of the Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.

verses.text: Blessed and holy is he that has part in this first resurrection; over such the second death has no power; but they shall be priests of God and of the Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.

sinaiticus.text: And when the thousand years shall have been completed, Satan shall be loosed from his prison,

verses.text: And when the thousand years shall have been completed, Satan shall be loosed from his prison,

sinaiticus.text: and shall go out to deceive the nations that are in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to bring them together to battle: the number of these is as the sand of the sea.

verses.text: and shall go out to deceive the nations that are in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to bring them together to battle: the number of these is as the sand of the sea.

sinaiticus.text: And they went up on the breadth of the earth, and encompassed the camp of the saints, and the beloved city; and fire came down out of heaven from God, and devoured them.

verses.text: And they went up on the breadth of the earth, and encompassed the camp of the saints, and the beloved city; and fire came down out of heaven from God, and devoured them.

sinaiticus.text: And the devil who deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are; and they shall be tormented day and night from age to age.

verses.text: And the devil who deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are; and they shall be tormented day and night from age to age.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat upon it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and no place was found for them.

verses.text: And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat upon it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and no place was found for them.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before the throne; and the books were opened; and another book was opened, which is the book of life; and the dead were judged out of the things that were written in the books, according to their works.

verses.text: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before the throne; and the books were opened; and another book was opened, which is the book of life; and the dead were judged out of the things that were written in the books, according to their works.

sinaiticus.text: And the sea gave up the dead that were in it; and death and hades have up the dead that were in them; and they were judged, every one according to his works.

verses.text: And the sea gave up the dead that were in it; and death and hades have up the dead that were in them; and they were judged, every one according to his works.

sinaiticus.text: And death and hades were cast into the lake of fire: this is the second death.

verses.text: And death and hades were cast into the lake of fire: this is the second death.

sinaiticus.text: And if any one was not found written in the book of life, he was thrown into the lake of fire.

verses.text: And if any one was not found written in the book of life, he was thrown into the lake of fire.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth; for the former heaven and the former earth had passed away; and the sea was no more.

verses.text: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth; for the former heaven and the former earth had passed away; and the sea was no more.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven, from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

verses.text: And I saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven, from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.

sinaiticus.text: And I heard a great voice out of heaven, saying: Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men and he will dwell with them; and they shall he his people, and God himself will be with them, their God.460

verses.text: And I heard a great voice out of heaven, saying: Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men and he will dwell with them; and they shall he his people, and God himself will be with them, their God.460

sinaiticus.text: And he will wipe every tear from their eyes, and there shall be no more death; neither shall there be any more sorrow, nor crying, nor pain; for the former things have passed away.

verses.text: And he will wipe every tear from their eyes, and there shall be no more death; neither shall there be any more sorrow, nor crying, nor pain; for the former things have passed away.

sinaiticus.text: And he that sat upon the throne said: Behold, I make all things new. And he said to me: Write, for these words are true and faithful.

verses.text: And he that sat upon the throne said: Behold, I make all things new. And he said to me: Write, for these words are true and faithful.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: It is done; I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. To him that thirsts, I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely.

verses.text: And he said to me: It is done; I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. To him that thirsts, I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely.

sinaiticus.text: He that overcomes shall inherit these things, and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.

verses.text: He that overcomes shall inherit these things, and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.

sinaiticus.text: But the fearful, and the unbelieving, and the detestable, and murderers, and lewd persons, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake that burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.

verses.text: But the fearful, and the unbelieving, and the detestable, and murderers, and lewd persons, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake that burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.

sinaiticus.text: And there came one of the seven angels that had the seven cups full of the seven last plagues; and he talked with me, saying: Come hither, and I will show you the bride, the Lamb’s wife.

verses.text: And there came one of the seven angels that had the seven cups full of the seven last plagues; and he talked with me, saying: Come hither, and I will show you the bride, the Lamb’s wife.

sinaiticus.text: And he carried me away in spirit to a mountain, great and high, and showed me the holy city, Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,

verses.text: And he carried me away in spirit to a mountain, great and high, and showed me the holy city, Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God,

sinaiticus.text: having the glory of God: that which gave it light was like a most costly stone, like jasper-stone, brilliant as crystal.

verses.text: having the glory of God: that which gave it light was like a most costly stone, like jasper-stone, brilliant as crystal.

sinaiticus.text: It had a wall, great and high; and it had twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel;

verses.text: It had a wall, great and high; and it had twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of Israel;

sinaiticus.text: on the east, three gates; on the north, three gates; on the south, three gates; and on the west, three gates.

verses.text: on the east, three gates; on the north, three gates; on the south, three gates; and on the west, three gates.

sinaiticus.text: And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.

verses.text: And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: And he that talked with me had a measure, a golden reed, that he might measure the city, and its gates, and its wall.

verses.text: And he that talked with me had a measure, a golden reed, that he might measure the city, and its gates, and its wall.

sinaiticus.text: And the city lies square; and its length is as great as its breadth. And he measured the city with the reed, twelve thousand furlongs: the length, and the breadth, and the height of it are equal.

verses.text: And the city lies square; and its length is as great as its breadth. And he measured the city with the reed, twelve thousand furlongs: the length, and the breadth, and the height of it are equal.

sinaiticus.text: And he measured the wall of it, a hundred and forty-four cubits, the measure of a man, that is, of an angel.

verses.text: And he measured the wall of it, a hundred and forty-four cubits, the measure of a man, that is, of an angel.

sinaiticus.text: And the wall of it was built of jasper; and the city was pure gold, like clear glass.

verses.text: And the wall of it was built of jasper; and the city was pure gold, like clear glass.

sinaiticus.text: And the foundations of the wall of the city were adorned with every costly stone: the first foundation was jasper; the second, sapphire; the third, chalcedony; the fourth, emerald;

verses.text: And the foundations of the wall of the city were adorned with every costly stone: the first foundation was jasper; the second, sapphire; the third, chalcedony; the fourth, emerald;

sinaiticus.text: the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, crysolite; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, topaz; the tenth, chrysoprase; the eleventh,

verses.text: the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, crysolite; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, topaz; the tenth, chrysoprase; the eleventh,

sinaiticus.text: And the twelve gates were twelve pearls; every gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold, like clear glass.

verses.text: And the twelve gates were twelve pearls; every gate was of one pearl: and the street of the city was pure gold, like clear glass.

sinaiticus.text: And I saw no temple in it; for the Lord God, the Almighty, and the Lamb, are its temple.

verses.text: And I saw no temple in it; for the Lord God, the Almighty, and the Lamb, are its temple.

sinaiticus.text: And the city had no need of the sun, nor of the moon, to shine in it; for the glory of God gave it light, and the lamp of it is the Lamb.

verses.text: And the city had no need of the sun, nor of the moon, to shine in it; for the glory of God gave it light, and the lamp of it is the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: And the nations shall walk by the light of it; and the kings of the earth bring their glory and their honor into it.

verses.text: And the nations shall walk by the light of it; and the kings of the earth bring their glory and their honor into it.

sinaiticus.text: And its gates shall not be shut at all by day; for there shall be no night there.

verses.text: And its gates shall not be shut at all by day; for there shall be no night there.

sinaiticus.text: And they shall bring the glory and honor of the nations into it.

verses.text: And they shall bring the glory and honor of the nations into it.

sinaiticus.text: And there shall not enter it any thing unclean, or that does what is detestable or that makes a lie; but those who are written in the Lamb’s book of life.

verses.text: And there shall not enter it any thing unclean, or that does what is detestable or that makes a lie; but those who are written in the Lamb’s book of life.

sinaiticus.text: And he showed me a river of water of life, clear as crystal, coming out from the throne of God and of the Lamb.

verses.text: And he showed me a river of water of life, clear as crystal, coming out from the throne of God and of the Lamb.

sinaiticus.text: In the midst of the street of the city, and on each side of the river, was the tree of life, which bore twelve kinds of fruit, and yielded its fruit every month; and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

verses.text: In the midst of the street of the city, and on each side of the river, was the tree of life, which bore twelve kinds of fruit, and yielded its fruit every month; and the leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

sinaiticus.text: And there shall be no more curse; and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it; and his servants shall serve him.

verses.text: And there shall be no more curse; and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it; and his servants shall serve him.

sinaiticus.text: And they shall see his face, and his name shall be in their foreheads.

verses.text: And they shall see his face, and his name shall be in their foreheads.

sinaiticus.text: And there shall be no more night; and they have no need of the lamp, nor of the light of the sun; for the Lord God will give them light; and they shall reign from age to age.

verses.text: And there shall be no more night; and they have no need of the lamp, nor of the light of the sun; for the Lord God will give them light; and they shall reign from age to age.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: These words are faithful and true; and the Lord God of the spirits of the prophets has sent his angel to show his servants the things that must shortly take place.

verses.text: And he said to me: These words are faithful and true; and the Lord God of the spirits of the prophets has sent his angel to show his servants the things that must shortly take place.

sinaiticus.text: And behold, I come quickly: blessed is he that keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.

verses.text: And behold, I come quickly: blessed is he that keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.

sinaiticus.text: And I, John, am he that saw and heard these things. And when I had heard and seen, I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel that showed me these things.

verses.text: And I, John, am he that saw and heard these things. And when I had heard and seen, I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel that showed me these things.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: See that you do it not; I am your fellow servant, and of your brethren the prophets, and of those who keep the words of this book: worship God.

verses.text: And he said to me: See that you do it not; I am your fellow servant, and of your brethren the prophets, and of those who keep the words of this book: worship God.

sinaiticus.text: And he said to me: Seal not the words of the prophecy of this book; for the time is at hand.462

verses.text: And he said to me: Seal not the words of the prophecy of this book; for the time is at hand.462

sinaiticus.text: He that is unjust, let him be unjust still; he that is polluted, let him be polluted still; and he that is righteous, let him be righteous still; and he that is holy, let him be holy still.

verses.text: He that is unjust, let him be unjust still; he that is polluted, let him be polluted still; and he that is righteous, let him be righteous still; and he that is holy, let him be holy still.

sinaiticus.text: . Behold, I come quickly, and my reward is with me to give to every one as his work shall be.

verses.text: . Behold, I come quickly, and my reward is with me to give to every one as his work shall be.

sinaiticus.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.

verses.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.

sinaiticus.text: Blessed are those who do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life, and that they may go through the gates into the city.

verses.text: Blessed are those who do his commandments, that they may have right to the tree of life, and that they may go through the gates into the city.

sinaiticus.text: Without are dogs and sorcerers and lewd persons and murderers and idolaters, and every one that loves and makes a lie.

verses.text: Without are dogs and sorcerers and lewd persons and murderers and idolaters, and every one that loves and makes a lie.

sinaiticus.text: I, Jesus, have sent my angel to testify these things to you for the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David, the bright morning star.

verses.text: I, Jesus, have sent my angel to testify these things to you for the churches. I am the root and the offspring of David, the bright morning star.

sinaiticus.text: And the Spirit and the bride say. Come; and let him that hears, say, Come; and let him that is thirsty, come; and let him that is willing, take the water of life freely.

verses.text: And the Spirit and the bride say. Come; and let him that hears, say, Come; and let him that is thirsty, come; and let him that is willing, take the water of life freely.

sinaiticus.text: I testify to every one that hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If any one add to these things. God will add to him the plagues that are written in this book;

verses.text: I testify to every one that hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If any one add to these things. God will add to him the plagues that are written in this book;

sinaiticus.text: and if any one take away from the words of the book of this prophecy. God will take away his part from the tree of life, and from the holy city; which things are written in this book.

verses.text: and if any one take away from the words of the book of this prophecy. God will take away his part from the tree of life, and from the holy city; which things are written in this book.

sinaiticus.text: He that testifies these things says: Surely, I come quickly. Amen: come, Lord Jesus. The Epistle of Barnabas

verses.text: He that testifies these things says: Surely, I come quickly. Amen: come, Lord Jesus. The Epistle of Barnabas
